verses.text: When Philopator heard from those who returned that the regions he ruled had been captured by Antiochus, he issued orders to all his infantry and cavalry forces, took his sister Arsinoe along with him, and set out toward the area near Raphia, where the forces of Antiochus were positioned. Now a certain Theodotus, intending to carry out a plan he had developed, took the finest of the Ptolemaic weapons issued earlier to him and crossed by night to Ptolemy's tent with the intention of killing him by himself, and in that way ending the war. But Dositheus, called the son of Drimylos, by birth Jew who afterward changed his religion and apostatized from the traditions of his fathers, removed the king and put in his place a certain unimportant man in the tent.
parts: When Philopator heard from those who returned that the regions he ruled had been captured by Antiochus, he issued orders to all his infantry and cavalry forces, took his sister Arsinoe along with him, and set out toward the area near Raphia, where the forces of Antiochus were positioned.

Now a certain Theodotus, intending to carry out a plan he had developed, took the finest of the Ptolemaic weapons issued earlier to him and crossed by night to Ptolemy's tent with the intention of killing him by himself, and in that way ending the war.

But Dositheus, called the son of Drimylos, by birth Jew who afterward changed his religion and apostatized from the traditions of his fathers, removed the king and put in his place a certain unimportant man in the tent.

verses.text: When a fierce battle took place and things were going rather well for Antiochus, Arsinoe went and exhorted the soldiers with her cries and tears.
parts: When a fierce battle took place and things were going rather well for Antiochus, Arsinoe went and exhorted the soldiers with her cries and tears.

verses.text: So it happened the enemy was defeated in hand-to-hand combat, and many were taken captive.
parts: So it happened the enemy was defeated in hand-to-hand combat, and many were taken captive.

verses.text: But having prevailed against the plot, Ptolemy decided to visit and encourage the neighboring cities.
parts: But having prevailed against the plot, Ptolemy decided to visit and encourage the neighboring cities.

verses.text: In doing so and by enriching their sacred precincts with gifts, he built up the morale of the conquered people.
parts: In doing so and by enriching their sacred precincts with gifts, he built up the morale of the conquered people.

verses.text: When the Jews sent representatives to him from the senate, they greeted him, brought him gifts, and congratulated him on the way things turned out.
parts: When the Jews sent representatives to him from the senate, they greeted him, brought him gifts, and congratulated him on the way things turned out.

verses.text: When he came to Jerusalem, he sacrificed to the Almighty God and made thank offerings and did what was appropriate in the place.
parts: When he came to Jerusalem, he sacrificed to the Almighty God and made thank offerings and did what was appropriate in the place.

verses.text: and he admired the good order of the temple and conceived a desire to enter into the inner sanctuary.
parts: and he admired the good order of the temple and conceived a desire to enter into the inner sanctuary.

verses.text: They told him, however, it was inappropriate for him to do this, since even citizens of their own nation were not allowed to enter, nor even all the priests.
parts: They told him, however, it was inappropriate for him to do this, since even citizens of their own nation were not allowed to enter, nor even all the priests.

verses.text: Even when the law was read to him, still he would not stop insisting that he should enter, saying, “Even if others are deprived of this honor, I must not be deprived.”
parts: Even when the law was read to him, still he would not stop insisting that he should enter, saying, “Even if others are deprived of this honor, I must not be deprived.”

verses.text: Then he asked why nobody ever prevented him from going into all the other shrines.
parts: Then he asked why nobody ever prevented him from going into all the other shrines.

verses.text: Someone said without thinking that it was improper to take that as a portent.
parts: Someone said without thinking that it was improper to take that as a portent.

verses.text: When that happened, he said that he would enter anyway, whether they liked it or not.
parts: When that happened, he said that he would enter anyway, whether they liked it or not.

verses.text: Then the priests, fully vested, prostrated themselves and supplicated God Most High to help them in the present circumstances, to turn away the impulse of the man of evil design.
parts: Then the priests, fully vested, prostrated themselves and supplicated God Most High to help them in the present circumstances, to turn away the impulse of the man of evil design.

verses.text: Those who remained in the city rushed out, supposing that something mysterious was happening.
parts: Those who remained in the city rushed out, supposing that something mysterious was happening.

verses.text: Even the virgins who had remained in their chambers rushed out with their mothers and sprinkled dust on their hair, filling the streets with wailing and groaning.
parts: Even the virgins who had remained in their chambers rushed out with their mothers and sprinkled dust on their hair, filling the streets with wailing and groaning.

verses.text: Those, too, who were recently brought to their bridal chambers abandoned the modesty that was appropriate for them and raced through the city in a disorderly manner.
parts: Those, too, who were recently brought to their bridal chambers abandoned the modesty that was appropriate for them and raced through the city in a disorderly manner.

verses.text: At that point, mothers and nurses even abandoned their newborns here and there, some at home and others in the streets, and without looking back crowded into the most high temple.
parts: At that point, mothers and nurses even abandoned their newborns here and there, some at home and others in the streets, and without looking back crowded into the most high temple.

verses.text: The prayers of those gathered were of varied forms because of what the king was plotting in such an unholy way.
parts: The prayers of those gathered were of varied forms because of what the king was plotting in such an unholy way.

verses.text: Besides, more aggressive citizens would in no way tolerate the carrying out of his plan or the fulfillment of his intention.
parts: Besides, more aggressive citizens would in no way tolerate the carrying out of his plan or the fulfillment of his intention.

verses.text: They shouted to their neighbors to make a run on the weapons and to die courageously for the law of their fathers.
parts: They shouted to their neighbors to make a run on the weapons and to die courageously for the law of their fathers.

verses.text: In the meantime, the multitude returned to prayer as before.
parts: In the meantime, the multitude returned to prayer as before.

verses.text: The elders close by the king made many attempts to divert his haughty mind from the plan he had concocted.
parts: The elders close by the king made many attempts to divert his haughty mind from the plan he had concocted.

verses.text: But in his arrogance he dismissed everything they said and began to approach the place, determined to complete his plan.
parts: But in his arrogance he dismissed everything they said and began to approach the place, determined to complete his plan.

verses.text: When those around the king observed this, they turned to one another and called upon Him who is all-powerful to come to their aid in this current struggle and not to ignore this lawless and arrogant act.
parts: When those around the king observed this, they turned to one another and called upon Him who is all-powerful to come to their aid in this current struggle and not to ignore this lawless and arrogant act.

verses.text: But because of the continual impassioned shouting of the crowds, it seemed that not only those present but also the very walls and the earth itself were echoing the cry, for they all preferred death to the profaning of the temple.

headers: Ptolemy Tries to Enter the Temple

verses.text: The high priest Simon bent his knees before the temple and stretched out his hands with great dignity, calmly offering the following prayer: “O Lord, Lord, King of the heavens and Master of all creation, Holy One among the holy ones, the only Ruler, the Almighty: attend to us who are grievously oppressed by an unholy and irreverent man who is arrogant in his audacity and power. For You, the Creator of all and Ruler over all, are a righteous Master, and You judge those who do anything with insolence and arrogance.
parts: The high priest Simon bent his knees before the temple and stretched out his hands with great dignity, calmly offering the following prayer:

“O Lord, Lord, King of the heavens and Master of all creation, Holy One among the holy ones, the only Ruler, the Almighty: attend to us who are grievously oppressed by an unholy and irreverent man who is arrogant in his audacity and power.
For You, the Creator of all and Ruler over all, are a righteous Master, and You judge those who do anything with insolence and arrogance.

verses.text: In the past You destroyed those who acted unjustly, among whom were the giants who trusted in their physical strength and boldness, whom You destroyed by bringing the great flood of water upon them.
parts: In the past You destroyed those who acted unjustly, among whom were the giants who trusted in their physical strength and boldness, whom You destroyed by bringing the great flood of water upon them.

verses.text: You burned up with fire and brimstone the inhabitants of Sodom, who acted in arrogance and were notorious for their evil acts, and You made them an example for those who came after them.
parts: You burned up with fire and brimstone the inhabitants of Sodom, who acted in arrogance and were notorious for their evil acts, and You made them an example for those who came after them.

verses.text: You made known Your might and power among men and brought many different acts of punishment on the arrogant Pharaoh, who enslaved Your holy people Israel.
parts: You made known Your might and power among men and brought many different acts of punishment on the arrogant Pharaoh, who enslaved Your holy people Israel.

verses.text: For when he chased after them with horse-drawn chariots and a myriad of troops, You overwhelmed him in the depths of the sea, and brought across to safety those who trusted in You, the King of all creation.
parts: For when he chased after them with horse-drawn chariots and a myriad of troops, You overwhelmed him in the depths of the sea, and brought across to safety those who trusted in You, the King of all creation.

verses.text: So when they considered the works of Your hands, they praised You, the Almighty God.
parts: So when they considered the works of Your hands, they praised You, the Almighty God.

verses.text: “You, O King, created the endless and measureless earth and chose this city.
parts: “You, O King, created the endless and measureless earth and chose this city.

verses.text: “Because You love the house of Israel, You promised that if we should suffer setbacks and if distress should overtake us, You would hear our supplication when we come into this place to pray.
parts: “Because You love the house of Israel, You promised that if we should suffer setbacks and if distress should overtake us, You would hear our supplication when we come into this place to pray.

verses.text: Indeed, You are faithful and true.
parts: Indeed, You are faithful and true.

verses.text: But often when our fathers were afflicted, You helped them in humility and saved them from great evils.
parts: But often when our fathers were afflicted, You helped them in humility and saved them from great evils.

verses.text: Behold, O holy King, how we are oppressed because of our manifold sins, subjected to our enemies and lying in helplessness.
parts: Behold, O holy King, how we are oppressed because of our manifold sins, subjected to our enemies and lying in helplessness.

verses.text: In our downfall this arrogant and ungodly man continues to desecrate the holy place which is dedicated to the name of Your glory on the earth.
parts: In our downfall this arrogant and ungodly man continues to desecrate the holy place which is dedicated to the name of Your glory on the earth.

verses.text: Your dwelling place, the heaven of the heavens, is unapproachable by men.
parts: Your dwelling place, the heaven of the heavens, is unapproachable by men.

verses.text: But since You by Your grace consented to grant Your glory upon Your people Israel, You hallowed this place.
parts: But since You by Your grace consented to grant Your glory upon Your people Israel, You hallowed this place.

verses.text: Do not punish us for the defilement caused by these men, and do not chastise us for this profanity.
parts: Do not punish us for the defilement caused by these men, and do not chastise us for this profanity.

verses.text: that they trampled the house of holiness as the houses of abominations are trampled.
parts: that they trampled the house of holiness as the houses of abominations are trampled.

verses.text: “Wipe away our sins, disperse our errors, and display Your compassion at this hour.
parts: “Wipe away our sins, disperse our errors, and display Your compassion at this hour.

verses.text: Let Your mercies come upon us quickly.
parts: Let Your mercies come upon us quickly.

verses.text: Then God, who watches over all, our Holy Forefather among the holy ones, heard this lawful supplication and scourged the man who raised himself up in arrogance and audacity.
parts: Then God, who watches over all, our Holy Forefather among the holy ones, heard this lawful supplication and scourged the man who raised himself up in arrogance and audacity.

verses.text: He shook him on one side and the other, as a reed is shaken by the wind, so that he lay powerless on the ground.
parts: He shook him on one side and the other, as a reed is shaken by the wind, so that he lay powerless on the ground.

verses.text: Therefore his friends and bodyguards alike were struck by an overwhelming fear, seeing the severe punishment that overtook him.
parts: Therefore his friends and bodyguards alike were struck by an overwhelming fear, seeing the severe punishment that overtook him.

verses.text: Later, when he recovered, he still did not repent after being chastised, but went his way making bitter threats.
parts: Later, when he recovered, he still did not repent after being chastised, but went his way making bitter threats.

verses.text: Then Ptolemy crossed over to Egypt, where he increased his evil, assisted by the aforementioned drinking companions and comrades, who were unacquainted with anything righteous. He was not content with his countless acts of indecency, but audaciously proceeded to spread many evil reports throughout the region.
parts: Then Ptolemy crossed over to Egypt, where he increased his evil, assisted by the aforementioned drinking companions and comrades, who were unacquainted with anything righteous.
He was not content with his countless acts of indecency, but audaciously proceeded to spread many evil reports throughout the region.

parts: He undertook to spread abroad a public blame against the Jewish nation, and raising a plaque on the tower at the palace, he carved this inscription:

parts: “No one shall enter the temple who does not sacrifice, but all the Jews shall be gathered for a census for taxation and reduced to servant status.

verses.text: Those registered are to be branded by fire on their bodies with the ivy leaf symbol of Dionysus, and they will also return to their former status.”
parts: Those registered are to be branded by fire on their bodies with the ivy leaf symbol of Dionysus, and they will also return to their former status.”

verses.text: But so as not to appear an enemy to all, he wrote underneath: “If some of them prefer to join those initiated into the mysteries, they will have equal rights of citizenship with the Alexandrians.”
parts: But so as not to appear an enemy to all, he wrote underneath: “If some of them prefer to join those initiated into the mysteries, they will have equal rights of citizenship with the Alexandrians.”

verses.text: Some, then, obviously hated the price required to maintain godliness in the city.
parts: Some, then, obviously hated the price required to maintain godliness in the city.

verses.text: But most of them prevailed with a noble spirit and did not abandon their faith.
parts: But most of them prevailed with a noble spirit and did not abandon their faith.

verses.text: They remained hopeful of finding help, while loathing those who isolated themselves from them.
parts: They remained hopeful of finding help, while loathing those who isolated themselves from them.

verses.text: When the ungodly king heard this, he reached such a point of rage that he was angry not only at the Jews of Alexandria, but even more so against those in the countryside.
parts: When the ungodly king heard this, he reached such a point of rage that he was angry not only at the Jews of Alexandria, but even more so against those in the countryside.

verses.text: While these things were being organized, an antagonistic rumor was circulated against the Jewish nation by men who conspired to harm them.
parts: While these things were being organized, an antagonistic rumor was circulated against the Jewish nation by men who conspired to harm them.

verses.text: The Jews, though, maintained their goodwill and unswerving faith toward the throne.
parts: The Jews, though, maintained their goodwill and unswerving faith toward the throne.

verses.text: But because they worshiped God and lived by His precepts, they kept themselves separate from others with regard to food, and therefore appeared hateful to some.
parts: But because they worshiped God and lived by His precepts, they kept themselves separate from others with regard to food, and therefore appeared hateful to some.

verses.text: But they adorned their way of life with the good deeds of righteous people, and thus established themselves as honorable to all men.
parts: But they adorned their way of life with the good deeds of righteous people, and thus established themselves as honorable to all men.

verses.text: Yet those of other nations took no account of the good works the Jews offered the nation, which was the common talk of all men.
parts: Yet those of other nations took no account of the good works the Jews offered the nation, which was the common talk of all men.

verses.text: Instead they droned on about the differences in worship and foods, saying the Jews were not committed to the king or the authorities, but were hostile and in great opposition to his leadership.
parts: Instead they droned on about the differences in worship and foods, saying the Jews were not committed to the king or the authorities, but were hostile and in great opposition to his leadership.

verses.text: Now there were Greeks in the city who had not been harmed in any way by the Jews, yet they observed the growing crowds and unprecedented tumult surrounding these people.
parts: Now there were Greeks in the city who had not been harmed in any way by the Jews, yet they observed the growing crowds and unprecedented tumult surrounding these people.

verses.text: For it was incomprehensible to ignore such a large group which had done no wrong.
parts: For it was incomprehensible to ignore such a large group which had done no wrong.

verses.text: But already certain neighbors and business associates drew them aside, gave them pledges of protection, and offered more serious efforts toward their defense.
parts: But already certain neighbors and business associates drew them aside, gave them pledges of protection, and offered more serious efforts toward their defense.

verses.text: Then the king, who exalted himself in his current prosperity and did not consider the power of the Almighty God, assumed he could persist continually in the same purpose.
parts: Then the king, who exalted himself in his current prosperity and did not consider the power of the Almighty God, assumed he could persist continually in the same purpose.

verses.text: “King Ptolemy Philopator, to the commanders and soldiers in Egypt and the surrounding region, greetings and health. I myself and my government are well.
parts: “King Ptolemy Philopator, to the commanders and soldiers in Egypt and the surrounding region, greetings and health.
I myself and my government are well.

verses.text: I myself and my government are well.
parts: I myself and my government are well.

verses.text: When our expedition to Asia took place, as you know, and was brought to completion according to expectation by the help of the gods not lightly given,
parts: When our expedition to Asia took place, as you know, and was brought to completion according to expectation by the help of the gods not lightly given,

verses.text: we thought it fit not by force of the spear, but by equity and great benevolence, to foster the peoples inhabiting Coelesyria and Phoenicia and to willingly treat them well.
parts: we thought it fit not by force of the spear, but by equity and great benevolence, to foster the peoples inhabiting Coelesyria and Phoenicia and to willingly treat them well.

verses.text: We distributed large revenues to the priests around the cities, and also went to Jerusalem to honor the temple of those guilty people, who never cease from their folly.
parts: We distributed large revenues to the priests around the cities, and also went to Jerusalem to honor the temple of those guilty people, who never cease from their folly.

verses.text: They accepted our presence in word, yet were insincere in their deeds.
parts: They accepted our presence in word, yet were insincere in their deeds.

verses.text: we were carried away by arrogant old men who prevented us from entering.
parts: we were carried away by arrogant old men who prevented us from entering.

verses.text: Yet as they kept up their obvious hostility toward us, they became unique among the nations, because they lifted their heads against kings and benefactors and did not want to consider any deed as sincere.
parts: Yet as they kept up their obvious hostility toward us, they became unique among the nations, because they lifted their heads against kings and benefactors and did not want to consider any deed as sincere.

verses.text: “But we adapted ourselves to their foolishness and crossed into Egypt with victory.
parts: “But we adapted ourselves to their foolishness and crossed into Egypt with victory.

verses.text: Yet in this matter we proclaimed forgiveness to all of their kinsmen in Jerusalem.
parts: Yet in this matter we proclaimed forgiveness to all of their kinsmen in Jerusalem.

verses.text: “They, however, took it in a different spirit.
parts: “They, however, took it in a different spirit.

verses.text: Not only did they reject the priceless citizenship, but they even showed loathing in word and silence toward the few among them who were sincerely disposed toward us.
parts: Not only did they reject the priceless citizenship, but they even showed loathing in word and silence toward the few among them who were sincerely disposed toward us.

verses.text: Therefore we placed great trust in the signs that these men were ill-disposed toward us in every way.
parts: Therefore we placed great trust in the signs that these men were ill-disposed toward us in every way.

verses.text: So we have ordered that as soon as this letter arrives, those who live there with their wives and children should be sent to us immediately by force in iron shackles, bound securely on all sides, for a fatal and shameful massacre as is fitting to traitors.
parts: So we have ordered that as soon as this letter arrives, those who live there with their wives and children should be sent to us immediately by force in iron shackles, bound securely on all sides, for a fatal and shameful massacre as is fitting to traitors.

verses.text: When they have been punished, we are certain that our government will be established afterward in tranquility and security.
parts: When they have been punished, we are certain that our government will be established afterward in tranquility and security.

verses.text: “But whoever conceals any of the Jews, from old man to infant or even sucklings, will be killed with the cruelest tortures, along with his entire household. Whoever is willing to give information will receive the estate of the one who is punished, as well as two thousand drachmas of royal silver, and will be crowned with freedom.
parts: “But whoever conceals any of the Jews, from old man to infant or even sucklings, will be killed with the cruelest tortures, along with his entire household.
Whoever is willing to give information will receive the estate of the one who is punished, as well as two thousand drachmas of royal silver, and will be crowned with freedom.

verses.text: Every place without exception where a Jew is found concealed will become desolate and burned with fire, and will become useless for all time for every mortal creature.”
parts: Every place without exception where a Jew is found concealed will become desolate and burned with fire, and will become useless for all time for every mortal creature.”

verses.text: This is the manner in which the letter was written.
parts: This is the manner in which the letter was written.

verses.text: Wherever this decree arrived, a feast at public expense was arranged for the Gentiles with shouting and rejoicing, as the hatred they had harbored against the Jews before now appeared openly. But for the Jews, there was unceasing sorrow and lamentable crying with tears; everywhere their hearts burned, and with groans they bewailed the unexpected destruction that was suddenly inflicted on them.
parts: Wherever this decree arrived, a feast at public expense was arranged for the Gentiles with shouting and rejoicing, as the hatred they had harbored against the Jews before now appeared openly.

But for the Jews, there was unceasing sorrow and lamentable crying with tears; everywhere their hearts burned, and with groans they bewailed the unexpected destruction that was suddenly inflicted on them.

verses.text: But was there any district or city, or any inhabited place whatsoever, or any streets, that were not filled with their mourning and wailing?
parts: But was there any district or city, or any inhabited place whatsoever, or any streets, that were not filled with their mourning and wailing?

verses.text: For they were being sent off by the commanders of the city in such a bitter and ruthless spirit that even when some of their enemies saw them receive such unusual punishments before their eyes, they considered them a common object of pity, and wept for their miserable expulsion and the uncertainty of their lives.
parts: For they were being sent off by the commanders of the city in such a bitter and ruthless spirit that even when some of their enemies saw them receive such unusual punishments before their eyes, they considered them a common object of pity, and wept for their miserable expulsion and the uncertainty of their lives.

verses.text: A large group of old men, covered with gray hair, was forced to march swiftly, despite the sluggishness of their old age.
parts: A large group of old men, covered with gray hair, was forced to march swiftly, despite the sluggishness of their old age.

verses.text: Young women who had just stepped into their bridal chamber to enter married life exchanged delight for wailing.
parts: Young women who had just stepped into their bridal chamber to enter married life exchanged delight for wailing.

verses.text: In shackles and in view of the public, they were dragged along violently to the boat of embarkation.
parts: In shackles and in view of the public, they were dragged along violently to the boat of embarkation.

verses.text: Their husbands, in their vigorous youthful prime and with nooses encircling their necks instead of flowers, passed the remaining days of their wedding feast in lamentations rather than feasting and youthful celebration, as they saw the grave already before their feet.
parts: Their husbands, in their vigorous youthful prime and with nooses encircling their necks instead of flowers, passed the remaining days of their wedding feast in lamentations rather than feasting and youthful celebration, as they saw the grave already before their feet.

verses.text: But they were brought on board like wild animals in iron-bound restraints, some fastened by their necks to the benches of the ships, others with their feet secured in unbreakable fetters.
parts: But they were brought on board like wild animals in iron-bound restraints, some fastened by their necks to the benches of the ships, others with their feet secured in unbreakable fetters.

verses.text: In addition they had the thick deck above them; thus, darkness covered their eyes on all sides, and they were treated like betrayers during the entire voyage.
parts: In addition they had the thick deck above them; thus, darkness covered their eyes on all sides, and they were treated like betrayers during the entire voyage.

verses.text: When they were brought to the place called Schedia and their voyage was completed according to the king's decree, he directed that they be confined outside the city in the hippodrome, which had an immense outside perimeter.
parts: When they were brought to the place called Schedia and their voyage was completed according to the king's decree, he directed that they be confined outside the city in the hippodrome, which had an immense outside perimeter.

verses.text: But as this took place, the king heard that their Jewish compatriots from the city often went out secretly to lament the shameful suffering of their brothers.
parts: But as this took place, the king heard that their Jewish compatriots from the city often went out secretly to lament the shameful suffering of their brothers.

verses.text: Growing furious, he commanded that these visitors be treated in precisely the same way as the others, so they would not be spared any of their punishment.

parts: Their registration took place, then, with bitter haste and zealous diligence.

verses.text: The king was filled with great and constant joy as he established banquets to extol all his idols, with a mind that wandered far away from the truth.

verses.text: They said that although there were still many of them in the country, some of whom were gathered in their houses and others elsewhere in the region, it was impossible for all the commanders in Egypt to register them.

parts: Blessed is the Savior of Israel unto ages of ages!

author: The author is an unidentified Alexandrian Jew who wrote the book in Greek.
date: Early first century BC is a likely date, considering the book's literary affinities and textual similarities with 2 Maccabees.
theme: As with the previous Maccabean works, the predominant message is that God remains faithful to His chosen people, blessing and preserving them in tribulation. The book was written to console, exhort, and teach the Egyptian Jews in the midst of their tribulations, and to inspire faith in the providence of God (4:21) by recounting how the Jews had been delivered from similar trials in the past.
